data.sentence: The word فَأَخَذَتْهُمُ comes from the root ا خ ذ and is associated with the meanings:

data.meanings: to shout/cry, make noise. sayhatun - thunderbolt, shout, blast, terrible and mighty noise.
data.sentence: The word الصَّيْحَةُ comes from the root ص ي ح and is associated with the meanings: to shout/cry, make noise. sayhatun - thunderbolt, shout, blast, terrible and mighty noise.

data.meanings: to visit or greet in the morning. subhun/sabahun/isbaahun - the morning. misbaahun (pl. masaabih) - lamp. sabbah (vb. 2) - to come to, come upon, greet, drink in the morning. asbaha - to enter upon the time of the morning, appear, begin to do, to be, become, happen. musbih - one who does anything in or enters upon the morning.
data.sentence: The word مُصْبِحِينَ comes from the root ص ب ح and is associated with the meanings: to visit or greet in the morning. subhun/sabahun/isbaahun - the morning. misbaahun (pl. masaabih) - lamp. sabbah (vb. 2) - to come to, come upon, greet, drink in the morning. asbaha - to enter upon the time of the morning, appear, begin to do, to be, become, happen. musbih - one who does anything in or enters upon the morning.
